doc.wiki: Operating leverage is a measure of how revenue growth translates into growth in operating income. It is a measure of leverage, and of how risky, or volatile, a company's operating income is. There are various measures of operating leverage,[1] which can be interpreted analogously to financial leverage. One analogy is "fixed costs + variable costs = total costs ..similar to.. debt + equity = assets".
